description: This function generates a unit square decomposition, which is a grid of squares with a certain number of them filled in to form a perfect rectangle. The dimensions of the rectangle are randomly selected from all possible factorizations of the filled_count that fit within the available space. This visualization is used for teaching mathematical concepts such as factors, area, and multiplication.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Unit Square Decompositions
stimulus_type_specification.description: The unit_square_decomposition function can draw a grid of unit squares with a certain number of them filled in to form a perfect rectangle. The dimensions of the rectangle are randomly selected from all possible factorizations of the filled_count that fit within the available space. The function accepts inputs such as size, filled_count, rectangle_tiles, and height. The size and filled_count are required inputs, while rectangle_tiles and height are optional. The function always leaves 2 rows at the bottom and 2 columns at the right empty. This visualization is useful for teaching mathematical concepts such as factors, area, and multiplication.

details: size: The size of the grid
filled_count: The number of squares to be filled
rectangle_tiles: Optional parameter to specify the tiles of the rectangle
height: Optional parameter to specify the height of the grid
The size and filled_count must be positive integers
The filled_count cannot exceed the area of the grid minus 2 rows and 2 columns
The rectangle_tiles and height, if provided, must be positive integers
The function draws a grid of unit squares
A certain number of squares are filled in to form a perfect rectangle
The dimensions of the rectangle are randomly selected from all possible factorizations of the filled_count that fit within the available space
The function always leaves 2 rows at the bottom and 2 columns at the right empty
